events.name: Los Angeles Chargers at Las Vegas Raiders

headlines.description: — Four days was all the Las Vegas Raiders had to recover from their worst performance of the season.
headlines.shortLinkText: Four days after losing 3-0, Raiders set franchise scoring record, beat Chargers 63-21

headlines.description: — Trailing 17-3 late in the third quarter behind an offense that had struggled to move the ball, the Bengals needed Jake Browning to be nearly perfect — and he was.
headlines.shortLinkText: Jake Browning shines again for Bengals, rallying them to 27-24 overtime win over Vikings

headlines.description: — Gardner Minshew got the most out of his depleted supporting cast.
headlines.shortLinkText: Gardner Minshew, Colts bolster playoff chances, beat fading Steelers 30-13

headlines.description: — Jared Goff and the Detroit Lions bounced back and took a step toward ending a six-season playoff drought.
headlines.shortLinkText: Jared Goff throws 5 TD passes as NFC North-leading Lions bounce back, beat Broncos 42-17

headlines.description: — For Myles Garrett, there's no explanation for the Browns' strange season.
headlines.shortLinkText: Joe Flacco passes for 374 yards, rallies banged-up Browns to 20-17 win over Bears

events.name: Tampa Bay Buccaneers at Green Bay Packers

headlines.description: — Playing on a new team eager to reach the postseason, Baker Mayfield reversed his December fortunes at Lambeau Field.
headlines.shortLinkText: Baker Mayfield throws for 381 yards, 4 TDs, Bucs keep pace in NFC South by beating Packers 34-20

headlines.description: — The Houston Texans gave themselves a confidence boost winning without injured quarterback C.J. Stroud and several other key players.
headlines.shortLinkText: Texans win without Stroud, beating Titans 19-16 on Fairbairn's 54-yard field goal in OT

events.name: New York Jets at Miami Dolphins

headlines.description: — Mike McDaniel was certain his team would avoid another week of disappointment after the Dolphins saw a 14-point fourth-quarter lead fizzle in less than five minutes in their last outing.
headlines.shortLinkText: Mostert, Tagovailoa lead Dolphins to a 30-0 victory over the Jets without Tyreek Hill

events.name: Kansas City Chiefs at New England Patriots

headlines.description: — This was a surprise look, even for the always unpredictable Patrick Mahomes.
headlines.shortLinkText: Chiefs beat Patriots 27-17 to thrill Taylor Swift, Swifties in crowd

events.name: New York Giants at New Orleans Saints

headlines.description: — Derek Carr quieted the boobirds in the Superdome and Saints defensive players were the ones making Italian-style hand gestures after a season-high seven sacks.
headlines.shortLinkText: Carr throws 3 TD passes as Saints top Giants 24-6 to remain tied atop NFC South

headlines.description: — Panthers interim head coach Chris Tabor has spent three years coaching Eddy Pineiro in Chicago and now Carolina, and his confidence level in the 28-year-old kicker is unwavering.
headlines.shortLinkText: Pineiro's field goal gives Panthers 9-7 win over Falcons, knocks Atlanta out of 1st in NFC South

events.name: Washington Commanders at Los Angeles Rams

headlines.description: — On the second play of the second half, Cooper Kupp found himself running completely alone down the Commanders' sideline behind their NFL-worst pass defense.
headlines.shortLinkText: Matthew Stafford throws 2 TD passes, Rams rise in NFC playoff race with 28-20 win over Commanders

headlines.description: — Deebo Samuel was stunned to be so wide open for San Francisco's first touchdown of the game. A few quarters later, Christian McCaffrey had enough time to
headlines.shortLinkText: McCaffrey scores 3 TDs and 49ers clinch NFC West with 45-29 rout of Cardinals for 6th straight win

headlines.description: — The Bills' offense has found its legs in time to make a playoff push.
headlines.shortLinkText: James Cook leads dominant rushing attack as Bills trample Cowboys 31-10

headlines.description: — Lamar Jackson was sacked, or so it seemed.
headlines.shortLinkText: Ravens beat mistake-prone Jaguars 23-7 for 4th consecutive victory and clinch AFC playoff spot

headlines.description: — Amid the flood of emotions that continued long after he walked off the field a winner, Drew Lock paused briefly to reflect.
headlines.shortLinkText: Drew Lock's late touchdown pass rallies Seahawks to 20-17 victory over sliding Eagles
